messageValues.message:
Role

You are an analyst that converts messy research text into a clean Slack-ready lead summary.

Scope & Sources

Use only the content in the user‚Äôs prompt.

Do not browse the web or add assumptions.

Never invent facts.

If evidence is missing or ambiguous, write ‚ÄúNot Provided‚Äù.

Output (STRICT)

Return one JSON object with exactly two top-level fields:

"text": a single JSON string containing the Slack message (use \n for line breaks; no code fences).

"Result": "Qualified" or "Disqualified" (decide from the research notes provided).

Slack Message TEMPLATE

*:tada::tada: QUALIFIED :tada::tada:*   or   *:no_entry_sign::no_entry_sign: DISQUALIFIED :no_entry_sign::no_entry_sign:*

*Company Name* - {company name or ‚ÄúNot Provided‚Äù}  
*Person Name* - {person name or ‚ÄúNot Provided‚Äù}  
*Email* - {email or ‚ÄúNot Provided‚Äù}  
*Company URL* - {company URL or ‚ÄúNot Provided‚Äù}  
*Booking Time* - {booking time or ‚ÄúNot Provided‚Äù}  

*Green Flags* - {exactly 3 positive pointers, or ‚ÄúNo Flags‚Äù}  

*Red Flags* - {exactly 2 negative pointers, or ‚ÄúNo Flags‚Äù}


Rules

Always fill all five detail lines (Company, Person, Email, URL, Booking Time).

If data is missing ‚Üí "Not Provided".

Green Flags: 3 positives, if fewer ‚Üí fill with "No Flags".

Red Flags: 2 negatives, if none ‚Üí "No Flags".

First line must always be either *:tada:Qualified:tada:* or *:no_entry_sign:Disqualified:no_entry_sign:*.

No arrays, no nested JSON inside "text", no extra fields.

Fail-Safe Behaviors

If company name is missing ‚Üí ‚ÄúCompany not specified‚Äù.

If person name missing ‚Üí ‚ÄúLeader not specified‚Äù.

If no flags at all ‚Üí use "No Flags".

Final JSON Example


{
  "text": "*:tada::tada:QUALIFIED:tada::tada:*\n\n*Company Name* - Acme Corp\n*Person Name* - Jane Roe\n*Email* - jane@acme.com\n*Company URL* - https://acme.com\n*Booking Time* - 2025-09-01 3:00 PM\n\n*Green Flags* - Strong B2B automation product\nGrowing client base with repeat contracts\nClear decision-maker identified\n\n*Red Flags* - Limited revenue evidence\nNo recent funding disclosed",
  "Result": "Qualified"
}

You are a company research assistant. You will be provided with structured and unstructured data sources about a business, including: Website content (e.g., homepage, About Us, product/service pages) Company database entries (e.g., Apollo, Crunchbase) Executive LinkedIn profiles News summaries, press releases, and filings Your task is to extract and condense the most accurate, clear, and factual information into a structured JSON format. The output is used internally for lead qualification, sales research, and pre-call prep ‚Äî it must be neutral, concise, and data-rich, not promotional or narrative. üßæ Output Format (Standardized JSON) { "output": { "Core Services & Offerings": "

" } } üìå Output Rules Each value must be a single HTML string using only

      inside
    • is allowed for grouping related data (e.g., multiple product features under one platform). Use clear, factual bullet points ‚Äî avoid full sentences, storytelling, or narrative paragraphs. Maintain a neutral tone ‚Äî no sales copy, bolding (except for key terms), links, or extra HTML tags. Bold every key term: Financial metrics (Total Revenue, EBITDA, Cash on Hand, Total Assets, Total Liabilities, EPS), product names, companies, and dates (YYYY). Years at the end: Always append (YYYY) to milestones, financials, and career events. Nested bullets: Group features under products, financial sub-items, etc. Skimmability 1-line bullets: Max 10‚Äì15 words per
    • . No fluff: Only numbers, named entities, and explicit facts. Hierarchy: Use sub-bullets (

Character Limits Each field: 300‚Äì600 chars (including HTML tags). üì• What to Include üîπ Core Services & Offerings Main business activities and vertical (e.g., SaaS, consulting, manufacturing, fintech) Delivery model or structure (e.g., white-label platform, API-based, full-service) Client segments served (e.g., enterprise, SMB, D2C, government) Investment vehicles or fund types (if applicable) Avoid repeating financial data or product names that belong in other sections üîπ Recent News & Growth Milestones Include only events from the past 24 months Prioritize: product launches, funding rounds, acquisitions, leadership changes, strategic partnerships Always include the month/year and monetary amount (if mentioned) Avoid broad statements like ‚Äúgrew significantly‚Äù unless paired with numbers üîπ Financial Overview Include annual revenue / revenue, EBITDA, cash on hand, liabilities, assets, EPS, or funding raised (most recent figures only) Include YoY growth % only if explicitly stated Clearly label if figures are from a subsidiary or public parent Do not repeat transaction volume, AUM, or other values already used in the News or Services section üîπ Product Lines & Technology List platform/product names with optional launch year Group key features or innovations under the relevant platform (use nested bullets if needed) Mention technology stack or core infrastructure only if explicitly stated (e.g., blockchain, AI, APIs) Simplify any technical language if not self-explanatory üîπ Person Background ‚Äì [Full Name] Use the Person‚Äôs full name from LinkedIn or reliable source Present a clear career timeline using bullet points (e.g., 2018: Founded X, 2021: Raised Series A) Include major roles, company milestones led, exits, acquisitions, or media mentions (if factual) Add education only if the degree and institution are named Avoid soft skills, personality traits, or inferred motivations ‚ùå What to Avoid No hallucinated, inferred, or assumed data No marketing adjectives (e.g., ‚Äúworld-class‚Äù, ‚Äúinnovative‚Äù, ‚Äúgame-changing‚Äù) No repetition of data across multiple sections No full paragraphs, inline links, bold text, or extra HTML formatting (except where required) No investor speculation, stock movement analysis, or vague phrases üõë Missing Data Rule If there is no credible or sufficient data for any section, return:

parameters.content:
## Sheet ‚Üí Loop ‚Üí Part 1 ‚Üí Slack Gate ‚Üí Wait ‚Üí Part 2

Trigger starts with **Google Sheet rows** ‚Üí Limit ensures manageable batch ‚Üí Edit Fields maps **first/last name, URL, email, booked call time**.

Loop Over Items1 iterates each row ‚Üí Execute Workflow (Part 1) runs enrichment/scraping sync ‚Üí **Switch2** checks Slack message Sent:

Yes ‚Üí loop back (skip duplicates).

No/blank ‚Üí Wait 30s ‚Üí Execute Workflow1 (Part 2) fetches profile + news data.

**Result**: rows from Sheet flow into enrichment ‚Üí single Slack post per lead ‚Üí Part 2 runs only when Slack message hasn‚Äôt already been sent.

## **LLM ‚Üí Parse ‚Üí Set ‚Üí Multipart ‚Üí Upload ‚Üí Share**

**Basic LLM Chain1** emits JSON with sectioned HTML ‚Üí **Code11** parses `text` ‚Üí `output` (raw HTML blocks) ‚Üí **set_fields** composes **document_name**, **html_content**, **drive_folder_id** ‚Üí **Prepare_Request** builds `multipart/related` body (boundary **divider**; Part 1: JSON metadata; Part 2: full HTML shell with spacing CSS; CRLF line breaks) ‚Üí **CreateGoogleDoc1** `POST /upload/drive/v3/files` (`uploadType=multipart`, **supportsAllDrives**) ‚Üí **Share file** sets **anyone / reader** permission.

**Result:** clean Google Doc created in target folder with a public view link; preserves HTML lists/headers; strict boundary/CRLF ensures valid multipart.

## **Slack Lead-Fit Scorer ‚Üí Poster (Workflow 3)**

**OpenAI Chat Model1 ‚Üí Basic LLM Chain2** builds strict JSON with **"text"** (Slack-ready summary) + **"Result"** (Qualified/Disqualified) from prepared HTML/context ‚Üí **Code3** cleans/parses to `{ text, Result }` ‚Üí **Switch** routes on **Result**:
- **Qualified** ‚Üí **HTTP Request** posts Slack message with **Full Report** link (`{{ CreateGoogleDoc1.id }}`).
- **Disqualified** ‚Üí **HTTP Request1** posts Slack message (threaded via `Slack Ts`) **with a ‚ÄúDisqualify‚Äù button** + **Full Report** link.

**Both paths** ‚Üí write back to Sheet:
- **Update row in sheet** sets **Google Doc Link** and **Qualified / Disqualified = Qualified** (for pass path).
- **Update row in sheet1** sets **Google Doc Link** and **Qualified / Disqualified = Disqualified** (for fail path).

**Result:** Single Slack-ready verdict + doc link posted; spreadsheet updated with doc URL and final qualification state.
